trans-unit.source: MapReduce and SSH connection with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: MapReduce and SSH connection with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use SSH to run MapReduce jobs using Hadoop on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use SSH to run MapReduce jobs using Hadoop on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to use Secure Shell (SSH) to connect to a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster and then submit MapReduce jobs by using Hadoop commands.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to use Secure Shell (SSH) to connect to a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster and then submit MapReduce jobs by using Hadoop commands.

trans-unit.source: If you are already familiar with using Linux-based Hadoop servers, but you are new to HDInsight, see <linkText>Linux-based HDInsight tips</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are already familiar with using Linux-based Hadoop servers, but you are new to HDInsight, see <linkText>Linux-based HDInsight tips</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: A Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster
trans-unit.target: A Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster

trans-unit.source: An SSH client.
trans-unit.target: An SSH client.

trans-unit.source: Linux, Unix, and Mac operating systems should come with an SSH client.
trans-unit.target: Linux, Unix, and Mac operating systems should come with an SSH client.

trans-unit.source: Windows users must download a client, such as <linkText>PuTTY</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Windows users must download a client, such as <linkText>PuTTY</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your HDInsight cluster by using the SSH command.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your HDInsight cluster by using the SSH command.

trans-unit.source: The FQDN will be the name you gave the cluster, followed by .azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: The FQDN will be the name you gave the cluster, followed by .azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following would connect to a cluster named myhdinsight:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following would connect to a cluster named myhdinsight:

trans-unit.source: If you provided a certificate key for SSH authentication when you created the HDInsight cluster, you may need to specify the location of the private key on your client system, for example:
trans-unit.target: If you provided a certificate key for SSH authentication when you created the HDInsight cluster, you may need to specify the location of the private key on your client system, for example:

trans-unit.source: If you provided a password for SSH authentication when you created the HDInsight cluster, you will need to provide the password when prompted.
trans-unit.target: If you provided a password for SSH authentication when you created the HDInsight cluster, you will need to provide the password when prompted.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, OS X, and Unix</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, OS X, and Unix</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Windows does not provide a built-in SSH client.
trans-unit.target: Windows does not provide a built-in SSH client.

trans-unit.source: We recommend using PuTTY, which can be downloaded from http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html.
trans-unit.target: We recommend using PuTTY, which can be downloaded from http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using PuTTY, see <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows </linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using PuTTY, see <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows </linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After you are connected to the HDInsight cluster, use the following Hadoop command to start a MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: After you are connected to the HDInsight cluster, use the following Hadoop command to start a MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: This starts the wordcount class, which is contained in the hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar file.
trans-unit.target: This starts the wordcount class, which is contained in the hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar file.

trans-unit.source: As input, it uses the wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt document, and output is stored at wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput.
trans-unit.target: As input, it uses the wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt document, and output is stored at wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput.

trans-unit.source: For more information about this MapReduce job and the example data, see <linkText>Use MapReduce in Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about this MapReduce job and the example data, see <linkText>Use MapReduce in Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The job emits details as it processes, and it returns information similar to the following when the job completes:
trans-unit.target: The job emits details as it processes, and it returns information similar to the following when the job completes:

trans-unit.source: When the job completes, use the following command to list the output files that are stored at wasb://example/data/WordCountOutput:
trans-unit.target: When the job completes, use the following command to list the output files that are stored at wasb://example/data/WordCountOutput:

trans-unit.source: This should display two files, _SUCCESS and part-r-00000.
trans-unit.target: This should display two files, _SUCCESS and part-r-00000.

trans-unit.source: The part-r-00000 file contains the output for this job.
trans-unit.target: The part-r-00000 file contains the output for this job.

trans-unit.source: Some MapReduce jobs may split the results across multiple part-r-##### files.
trans-unit.target: Some MapReduce jobs may split the results across multiple part-r-##### files.

trans-unit.source: If so, use the ##### suffix to indicate the order of the files.
trans-unit.target: If so, use the ##### suffix to indicate the order of the files.

trans-unit.source: To view the output, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To view the output, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: This displays a list of the words that are contained in the wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt file and the number of times each word occured.
trans-unit.target: This displays a list of the words that are contained in the wasb://example/data/gutenberg/davinci.txt file and the number of times each word occured.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of the data that will be contained in the file:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of the data that will be contained in the file:

trans-unit.source: As you can see, Hadoop commands provide an easy way to run MapReduce jobs in an HDInsight cluster and then view the job output.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, Hadoop commands provide an easy way to run MapReduce jobs in an HDInsight cluster and then view the job output.

trans-unit.target: For general information about MapReduce jobs in HDInsight:
